title: Crédito Real Fires Advisers, Scraps Plans to File for Bankruptcy in the U.S.
sub_head: The shadow bank was planning on filing for bankruptcy in the U.S. within days
body:
Mexican shadow bank Crédito Real S.A.B. de C.V., which specializes in payroll loans to low- and lower-middle income borrowers in Latin America, has scrapped plans to file for U.S. bankruptcy protection and fired legal and financial advisers who were preparing a chapter 11 filing for the business, according to people familiar with the matter.
The company has been in talks with creditors after it defaulted on a Swiss franc-denominated bond in February. It planned to file for chapter 11 in the U.S. as part of a comprehensive...
